title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: The immigration minister has defended the government’s record on asylum seekers and dismissed Labor’s recent attack as a “pretty significant own goal”. Figures released to Labor through questions on notice revealed 4,037 people flew to Australia and sought asylum in the first seven weeks of this financial year. Speaking with Sky News, David Coleman said the number of people the department had granted visas to had actually dropped. “The reality is we are approving less than Labor did,” he said. “People who arrive onshore are a fairly small proportion of our program, less than 10 per cent. Under Labor it was much more.” Image: News Corp Australia
